metadata.title: CVE-2021-43538 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
By misusing a race in our notification code, an attacker could haveforcefully hidden the notification for pages that had received full screenand pointer lock access, which could have been used for spoofing attacks.This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 91.4.0, Firefox ESR < 91.4.0, andFirefox < 95.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-43538` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 95.0+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 95.0+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 95.0+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:91.4.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.4.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.4.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.4.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.4.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.4.0+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '95.0+build1-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:91.4.0+build1-0ubuntu1').
mozjs78 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
